message: The pages are hitting our custom redis caching most of the time, and sometimes falling through to referencing the models directly
It would be amazing if we could do something like Comment(id=357, __defer__=True)
which would return the same thing as Comment.objects.only('id').get(id=357)
Any suggestions / ideas? Source diving into the queryset generator only left me with madness in my head :(
Yeah we want to completely avoid the database round trip, and also the query generator which is expensive when called repeatedly.
@t So SQL and Django's ORM right now are the canonical data store for Convore, but live updates are all shuttled through Redis.
err not request
lol@everyone

Canv.as is hybrid redis / MySQL backend, and we're moving more and more pages to fetch a list of ids from redis, get a list of model instances via in_bulk, and then grab more cached values via the model instances.
Ohh, because you're constructing it from Redis, got it
Model.object.defer(blah blah).get()
I don't blame the piano, I just don't understand why I was born different.
can't you just do request.object.defer('fields', 'to', 'defer').get(id=357)
Ahh, yes I see. Reading comprehension fail.
Probably better build a proxy object (possibly using Django's proxy meta flag) that loads most of the object all at once on a cache miss
@mgrouchy No because he's not actually getting it from the database, he's constructing the object from known data
When I write django I feel like I'm playing the piano with bigfoot's paws for hands.
@ericflo Are messages stored in SQL in Convore? How much of Django's model system are you using for the core mechanics of Convore?
I'm kind of confused, why not just do Comment.objects.only('id').get(id=357)?
@mgrouchy That will still try to issue a (useless) SQL query
The normal deferred stuff probably isn't what you want here though, since that will run one query per-attribute that is a miss in Redis (presumably you want to load several at once)
@t Everything

I'm just kind of tracing through Django code now to look for deferred stuff (I have no idea how internals of deferred fields work) and found this http://code.djangoproject.com/browser/django/trunk/django/db/models/query_utils.py#L67 probably helpful
Q; how i can make an excluded field in forum appear in Admin page?
Malcolmt is the third.
@coderanger Yeah I think that's what I'd do too
maybe deferred_class_factory, defer the unknown fields
@ericflo btw I fucking love the realtime star notification. We're doing that for Canv.as stickers too. At what point do we cobrand "Convore for business. Canvas for pleasure" ? ;)
@t You might want to downplay the .... sexual connotations :-P
@coderanger where's the "meta flag"?
@t class Meta: proxy=True
That will allow you to subclass a model without creating new tables and other ORMy things
@t There are roughly 3 people in the world that truly understand the ORM. Two of them are @alex
Oh oh, I see. Which is what deferred_class_factory already does. Thanks!
This should be enough for me to build what I want, or at least enough to get me running head first into something else Django I don't understand :)
I'm seeing deferred_class_factory which I'll effectively have to copy and then rewrite DeferredAttribute to fetch all fields on a single miss, which yeah @coderanger is definitely what I want.
@t hah :)
@freakboy3742 understands it as well
